intro: Charianthus alpinus, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from blue to purple. The plant thrives in alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sunlight. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Charianthus alpinus is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand cold temperatures and strong winds.
